i’m andrew zhang, a student at the university of california, irvine, double majoring in data science and education. i recently completed a data science internship at shamrock foods, where i implemented machine learning models to optimize transportation routes and reduce fuel costs. at ballard labs, i contributed to neurotriggering research using fmri, exploring how rewards influence decision-making processes. during my project management internship with the city of san diego, i improved project workflows and mentored junior staff, ensuring smooth operations. i have strong technical skills in python, java, c++, sql, and web development frameworks like react and node.js. i’m passionate about using data analytics and machine learning to solve real-world problems and look forward to applying my skills in future roles.
